meanings.definition: Yills (noun): a feeling of discomfort or unease
meanings.sent1: The loud thunderstorm outside gave me the yills.
meanings.sent2: The horror movie filled me with yills.
meanings.sent3: The creepy doll in the attic gave me the yills.
meanings.sent4: The eerie silence of the abandoned house sent yills down my spine.
meanings.sent5: The dark, shadowy forest was full of yills.

meanings.definition: Yills (verb): to cause discomfort or unease
meanings.sent1: The ghost stories yills me at night.
meanings.sent2: The haunted house yills visitors with its creaky floors.
meanings.sent3: The unexpected jump scare really yills the audience.
meanings.sent4: The eerie music yills the listeners with a sense of foreboding.
meanings.sent5: The mysterious stranger's gaze yills me.

meanings.sent1: The yills feeling in the dark alley made me shiver.
meanings.sent2: The yills sensation crept up my spine as I entered the abandoned house.
meanings.sent3: The yills atmosphere of the old graveyard was unsettling.
meanings.sent4: The yills sensation lingered long after the scary movie ended.
meanings.sent5: The yills sensation in the air hinted at something sinister.
